features: COOKING FUNCTIONS: This premium 1800 watt toaster oven and AirFryer, is equipped with AirFry setting plus toast, convection bake, bake, convection broil, broil, grill, warming feature, with a wide temperature range (Warm-450°F)
CAPACITY: Large enough to toast 6-slices of bread, air fry 3-pounds of chicken wings, bake a 12-inch pizza or roast a 4-pound chicken
SUPERIOR OPERATION: Equipped with an adjustable temperature dial, 60-minute timer/auto-shutoff and a toast shade selector to ensure your meals are cooked to your perfection
INCLUDES: Oven light, oven rack, baking pan, AirFry basket, grill and a nonstick easy-clean interior to make cleanup simple
LIMITED 3-YEAR WARRANTY: Refer to user manual for troubleshooting steps and questions surrounding warranty policies
body.description: Cuisinart’s signature AirFryer just got even better! In addition to AirFrying french fries, baking cookies or warming up your leftovers, now you can make even more delicious meals in your Cuisinart® AirFryer Toaster Oven with Grill! Sear steaks and vegetables on one side and griddle the perfect breakfast on the other with the new dual-sided grill and griddle plate. Bring next-generation cooking to your countertop with the spacious 8-function oven that makes cooking a feast for family and friends — or a simple snack for one — fun, fast, and easy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can I give it 10 stars
reviews.reviewText: This is one of my all time best purchases! It is the perfect toaster! Handles up to 6 slices depending on size of bread and browns them beautifully. The toaster selector is large easy to see and gives uniform results for same setting every time. I’ve used this daily for over a month now. All the timer/function selectors are the same easy to use eye height knobs and look great imo. I have used all the functions except the grill/griddle and love the ease and results from each. The crumb tray is genius, easily accessed from the outside and a non-stick surface wipes clean! This model has a smaller footprint so saves counter space. I am just thrilled with the engineering, design and functionality!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Air fry oven
reviews.reviewText: Works very well. Toasts up a frozen pizza better than using the conventional oven. Use the air bake option for this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Old school technology that defies the digital age
reviews.reviewText: This type of Cuisinart countertop “oven-airfryer-toaster” is available in various versions. Cuisinart has also chosen to create products specific to companies like Costco. I know because I purchased a Costco version of it with a dial and Digital control system for a time and temperature. Unfortunately, it died of premature death due to crappy electronics.Numerous other “Digital” versions are available.This machine, on the other hand, is at the opposite end of the spectrum. It literally uses mechanical clock work timers like an old-fashioned countertop egg timer with a knob.It goes tick-tick!Likewise, the temperature control appears to be old school involving some simple, analog circuitry and a thermocouple.This kind of technology has been around since the 1940s and it is reliable!!!Is it precise? Not so much, but if you are a competent cook, it’s wonderful. My smart phone can serve as a timer. I am OK with possible temperature fluctuations of 25° or so.This thing is wonderful. The grill pan is an incredible accessory. I have baked pies in it. made numerous batches of buffalo wings. Roasted half chickens. French fries. Roasted potatoes & Brussels sprouts. Grilled sausages. Meatloaf. Banana bread loaves. Muffins. The list goes on….Why use a huge oven that takes forever to heat up and uses more energy? Buy this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall great but may be defective
reviews.reviewText: My first oven arrived visually intact and fine but upon trying to roast some vegetables it steamed a lot from upper right corner. The door was poorly balanced and did not close properly. I read some answers in questions section and figured out that this is indeed an issue not to be ignored. That oven heated and cooked unevenly, back overcooked and front undercooked. The temperature was inconsistent. The first one goes back and replacement arrives. The second one appears to close more tightly and to not steam. Overall this oven is great in its simplicity and effectiveness. The tray easily holds enough food for 4. Hopefully I will get a lot of use from my replacement oven. Would be 5 stars if not for defective first one

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More well thought out than most
reviews.reviewText: My older air fryer toaster oven bit the dust, there were a few things I didn't like about it but in shopping for a new one, a newer version of my old one was looking better and better. Suddenly this popped up and its color matched my kitchen. It was also the size I was looking for as I have a shelf on the wall it must fit on. I figured I'd give it a try. Very glad I did. I use it almost every day. It toasts bread in a jiffy, and it's evenly toasted. I use it to heat things in ceramic bowls up. Heated up pizza slices. I've air fried onion rings, tater tots, French fries and homemade tortillas, all came out excellent. It's quite a powerful little oven. It's designed to have the air fryer basket sit inside a drip tray and most anything you cook, as long as it's not so big as to require the bottom shelf, you can have the drip tray under it, keeping the heating elements clean. It's been a snap to clean it too, never thought I'd say that about any toaster oven. I clean it after each use so the stuff doesn't get baked on. Quick and simple. I highly recommend this little oven!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use, lots of features, stylish
reviews.reviewText: I have not yet used all of the features this product offers but purchased it because I wanted an air fryer and like the idea of trying and indoor grill. This is a perfect size for a single person or small family. The first use was for air frying chicken wings. My boyfriend, a self proclaimed wings afficionado, immediately commented that he [now] prefers air frying wings over grilling them. The process for figuring out the perfect amount of time took a little practice but we were happy with the results after just a few tries. I've also used this for baking cookies, toasting bread, and warming up leftovers. The time and temp dials could be improved by providing smaller increments for greater accuracy. So far I'm very happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great energy saver…
reviews.reviewText: I always hated turning on my large oven for heating up leftovers. Nope, not nuking my food in a microwave. This warms up food quickly and perfectly without heating up the whole kitchen. It gets pizza crust and tortillas to a perfect crisp texture. I hesitated for some time because I didn’t want a big appliance on my counter but it looks nice and really doesn’t take up too much space. Turning on the oven is done by turning the timer which starts at the 10 minute mark so good luck guessing for a shorter time, it’s the only draw back I have come across in my short time using. Look forward to trying some serious cooking, I have high hopes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Although I love how this air fryer oven works, it is not reliable. I bought one a year ago and used it nearly every day. After a year, it stopped working. I recently bought a replacement of this same air fryer oven. It arrived this week and didn’t work right out of the box. I returned it. Now I have to find a different one that hopefully is more reliable.
